article.headline: Dow's 100-point climb highlighted by gains for Walt Disney, Salesforce.com Inc. stocks
article.body: Powered by positive gains for shares of Walt Disney and Salesforce.com Inc., the Dow Jones Industrial Average is trading up Friday morning. The Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading 108 points, or 0.4%, higher, as shares of Walt Disney DIS, +1.53% and Salesforce.com Inc. CRM, +2.21% are contributing to the index's intraday rally. Walt Disney's shares are up $1.93, or 1.6%, while those of Salesforce.com Inc. have risen $4.04, or 1.6%, combining for a roughly 39-point boost for the Dow. Also contributing significantly to the gain are Caterpillar CAT, +1.45%, Microsoft MSFT, +2.48%, and Cisco CSCO, +0.15%. A $1 move in any of the Dow's 30 components equates to a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
